channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Ilia Malinin, U.S. figure skater favored for gold, finishes 8th
item.description: Malinin, undefeated since 2023, stumbled and fell multiple times, landing far off the podium. Mikhail Shaidorov of Kazakhstan won gold in an upset that shocked even himself.
item.content:encoded:
Malinin, undefeated since 2023, stumbled and fell multiple times, landing far off the podium. Mikhail Shaidorov of Kazakhstan won gold in an upset that shocked even himself.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: DHS says immigration agents appear to have lied about shooting in Minnesota
item.description: Julio Cesar Sosa-Celis was shot in the leg during the incident. Another Venezuelan man was also accused of attacking an immigration officer.
item.content:encoded:
Julio Cesar Sosa-Celis was shot in the leg during the incident. Another Venezuelan man was also accused of attacking an immigration officer.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Venezuela debates sweeping amnesty for political prisoners
item.description: After the fall of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan regime promise amnesty and reconciliation — but for hundreds still jailed and thousands facing charges, justice remains uncertain.
item.content:encoded:
After the fall of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan regime promise amnesty and reconciliation — but for hundreds still jailed and thousands facing charges, justice remains uncertain.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: It's been five years since catastrophic Texas blackouts. How much has changed?
item.description: Power companies say they're better prepared for extreme weather, but challenges remain to electricity production as the state's demand grows
item.content:encoded:
Power companies say they're better prepared for extreme weather, but challenges remain to electricity production as the state's demand grows

(Image credit: Ron Jenkins)
item.dc:creator: Natalie Weber

item.title: FBI releases description of suspect, increases reward in Nancy Guthrie case
item.description: The FBI describes the armed man caught on Nancy Guthrie's camera as 5-foot-9-inches to 5-foot-10 and of average build. The 84-year-old mother of Savannah Guthrie has been missing since Feb. 1.
item.content:encoded: The FBI describes the armed man caught on Nancy Guthrie's camera as 5-foot-9-inches to 5-foot-10 and of average build. The 84-year-old mother of Savannah Guthrie has been missing since Feb. 1.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Virginia court allows Democrats' redistricting vote in their plan to counter to Trump
item.description: The ruling allows an April election where voters can let the legislature draw a new congressional map. It could help Democrats win more House seats. Republicans might still fight it in court.
item.content:encoded:
The ruling allows an April election where voters can let the legislature draw a new congressional map. It could help Democrats win more House seats. Republicans might still fight it in court.

(Image credit: Shaban Athuman)
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: A familiar move with a new twist: Trump tries to cut CDC funds he just signed into law
item.description: A federal judge in Illinois quickly issued a restraining order after the Trump administration slashed more than $600 million in CDC grants to four blue states.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge in Illinois quickly issued a restraining order after the Trump administration slashed more than $600 million in CDC grants to four blue states.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Kitty cats and cloud hands - how U.S. Olympic snowboarders keep calm in competition
item.description: U.S. snowboarders psych themselves up before competition with heavy metal and pop music, cat photos, and apparently many on the men's halfpipe team now do Qigong.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

U.S. snowboarders psych themselves up before competition with heavy metal and pop music, cat photos, and apparently many on the men's halfpipe team now do Qigong.

(Image credit: Abbie Parr)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Britain's High Court says government illegally banned Pro-Palestinian group
item.description: In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."
item.content:encoded:
In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: On their way! 4 people on NASA Crew-12 mission launch to International Space Station
item.description: The four are set to dock with the space station on Saturday, returning the orbital lab to its full complement of seven. NASA's last mission, Crew-11, left a month early due to an ill crew member.
item.content:encoded:
The four are set to dock with the space station on Saturday, returning the orbital lab to its full complement of seven. NASA's last mission, Crew-11, left a month early due to an ill crew member.

(Image credit: SpaceX via NASA)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis
